DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Clinician Assessment Esophagus Response Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the chronic graft versus host disease response for esophagus based on clinician assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Clinician Assessment Esophagus Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing more than 100 days post-transplant.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CCR 16C0094 study as requested by P.Asangong. mc 4/25/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: NIH Esophagus Score 0 after previous involvement

ValueMeaning.preferredName: NIH Esophagus Score 0 after previous involvement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An NIH esophagus score of 0 after previous GvHD involvement.

Concepts.definition: An NIH esophagus score of 0 after previous GvHD involvement.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Decrease NIH Esophagus Score by 1 or more points

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Decrease NIH Esophagus Score by 1 or more points
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An NIH esophagus score that has decreased by 1 or more points.

Concepts.definition: An NIH esophagus score that has decreased by 1 or more points.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Increase in NIH Esophagus Score by 1 or more points, except 0 to 1

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Increase in NIH Esophagus Score by 1 or more points, except 0 to 1
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An NIH esophagus score that has increased by 1 or more points, except 0 to 1.

Concepts.definition: An NIH esophagus score that has increased by 1 or more points, except 0 to 1.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
